item.title: Soham murderer Ian Huntley seriously injured in prison attack
item.content:encoded: The 52-year-old is serving a life sentence after being convicted of murdering schoolgirls Holly Wells and Jessica Chapman.

item.title: England consider spinner Ahmed for Colombo turner
item.content:encoded: England will consider leg-spinner Rehan Ahmed for Friday's T20 World Cup match against New Zealand with spinning conditions expected.

item.title: Woman fell from window trying to flee triple killer
item.content:encoded: A former neighbour of Valdo Calocane was told he could have killed her, years before the attacks.

item.title: Tracey Emin says her artwork My Bed would be 'tidy, clean and boring' if she made it today
item.content:encoded: Her Turner Prize-nominated messy bed caused a stir in the late 1990s and is now going back on display.

item.title: Hillary Clinton to appear before US House panel investigating Epstein
item.content:encoded: The former secretary of state recently dropped her longstanding refusal to appear, alongside her former president husband.

item.title: Traitor Rachel on winning the show, her mum's death - and what's next
item.content:encoded: Rachel Duffy has spoken publicly for the first time about winning The Traitors and then losing her mother.

item.title: Warren in '$1bn legal dispute' over Zuffa Boxing launch
item.content:encoded: Veteran promoter Frank Warren confirms he is considering legal action against Saudi Arabian-owned Sela and American company TKO.

item.title: Spain to check Gibraltar arrivals under post-Brexit deal
item.content:encoded: Travellers to the Rock from the UK would have to show their passport twice under a new UK-EU treaty.

item.title: World Economic Forum boss quits after review of Epstein links
item.content:encoded: Brende acknowledged communications with Epstein but said he was "completely unaware" of his past criminal activity.

item.title: Instagram to alert parents if teens search for self-harm and suicide content
item.content:encoded: Safety campaigners say Meta is "passing the buck" with its new feature for parents using Instagram's teen supervision tools.

item.title: Corbyn set to become Your Party parliamentary leader
item.content:encoded: Ex-Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn's supporters won 14 of the 24 seats on Your Party's central executive committee (CEC).

item.title: Royal Mail bosses to be called to Parliament over letter delivery failures
item.content:encoded: It comes after hundreds of people contacted BBC Your Voice to express frustration over late deliveries.

item.title: Danish PM calls snap election with Greenland issue centre-stage
item.content:encoded: The issue of Greenland, which Donald Trump wants to annex, is likely to dominate the election campaign.

item.title: Ocado to axe 1,000 jobs in cost-cutting drive
item.content:encoded: The technology and online grocery group is cutting about 5% of its global workforce, with two-thirds of the losses in the UK.

item.title: RFU set to confirm radical revamp for English rugby
item.content:encoded: A radical new structure for English rugby is set to be rubber-stamped by the RFU, with the Prem separating from the rest of the pyramid, and promotion and relegation scrapped.

item.title: Benn to fight Prograis on Fury undercard
item.content:encoded: Conor Benn's bout against Regis Prograis will be the co-main event to Tyson Fury's comeback fight against Arslanbek Makhmudov in April.

item.title: US and Iran hold talks seen as crucial to prevent conflict
item.content:encoded: The indirect negotiations in Geneva are seen as a last-ditch effort, but the chances of a nuclear agreement are unclear.

item.title: Number of young people out of work or education edges closer to one million
item.content:encoded: People at the start of their careers are particularly affected by the UK's weak job market.

item.title: Nearly a million 16-24 year-olds not working or in education
item.content:encoded: People at the start of their careers are particularly affected by the UK's weak job market.

item.title: Singer D4vd confirmed as 'target' of investigation into murder of teen
item.content:encoded: The remains of 14-year-old Celeste Rivas Hernandez were found in the singer's car last year.

item.title: Bridgerton's first East Asian family is a beautiful thing, say cast
item.content:encoded: Stars of the hit Netflix show talk about the importance of representation as part two of season four lands.

item.title: A 'normal guy' doing 'brilliant' things - Lammens on life at Man Utd
item.content:encoded: Manchester United goalkeeper Senne Lammens says he is "just a normal guy", but his reputation is growing in an impressive debut season at Old Trafford.

item.title: Earth's heat to power 10,000 homes in renewable energy first for UK
item.content:encoded: Water super-heated by rocks will also provide the UK's first domestic supply of the critical mineral lithium.

item.content:encoded: Lord Mandelson's lawyers said police arrested the peer because of a "baseless" suggestion he was planning to move abroad.

item.content:encoded: Bills to let terminally ill people end their life are being considered at Westminster and in Scotland.

item.content:encoded: There were 4,793 people sleeping on the streets on a single night last autumn.

item.title: Trump joke 'overshadows' US women's Olympic success, says women's ice hockey captain
item.content:encoded: A "distasteful joke" by US President Donald Trump overshadows the achievement of female athletes at the Winter Olympics, says USA ice hockey gold medallist Hilary Knight.
